country.government: parliamentary democracy that retains as its heads of state a coprincipality

country.government: territory of Australia administered by the Australian Ministry for the Environment

country.name: Cambodia
country.government: multiparty liberal democracy under a constitutional monarchy established in September 1993

country.name: Hong Kong
country.government: dependent territory of the UK scheduled to revert to China on 1 July 1997

country.name: Macau
country.government: overseas territory of Portugal scheduled to revert to China in 1999

country.name: Syria
country.government: republic under military regime since March 1963

country.name: United Arab Emirates
country.government: federation with specified powers delegated to the UAE central government and other powers reserved to member emirates

country.name: Clipperton Island
country.government: French possession administered by France from French Polynesia by the High Commissioner of the Republic

country.name: Mexico
country.government: federal republic operating under a centralized government

country.government: unincorporated and unorganized territory of the US

country.government: self governing parliamentary government in free association with New Zealand

country.government: unincorporated territory of the US administered by the US Navy

country.government: constitutional government in free association with the US

country.government: constitutional government in free association with the US

country.name: Midway Islands
country.government: unincorporated territory of the US formerly administered by the US Navy

country.government: commonwealth in political union with the US

country.government: unincorporated territory of the US administered by the US Army and Strategic Defense Command since 1 October 1994
